item.title: Pokemon TCG Pocket: Best Articuno Deck Build
item.description:
Part of the massive appeal to the mobile TCG game, Pokemon Trading Card Game Pocket, is not only the ability to open digital booster packs and build a collection right from the comfort of your phone screen, but to also use your collection to form decks, as well as take on battle challenges — or matches against friends and other players in PvP.

Because of this, it's important to consider your deck very carefully, including which cards you wish to build around as your core targets, as well as the best picks to synergize with them and create a strong strategy. Articuno ex is one of the many cards available in the Genetic Apex set and has become a fine example of one of the many successful deck compositions, though it may be through a slightly unusual formula. Everything you'll need to know about how to craft the best Articuno deck in Pokemon TCG Pocket has been included in the guide below.

Best Articuno Deck In Pokemon TCG Pocket, Explained

In Pokemon TCG Pocket , Articuno ex is a card that has proven it can run very well in certain deck compositions, with one of them standing out significantly. The best deck for Articuno involves using an 18 Trainers formula , which, as the title suggests, involves selecting 18 out of your 20 cards to be various Trainers. While this may seem odd, there is a reason why this works so well, which is explained in greater detail below:

  • In Pokemon TCG Pocket , you are guaranteed at least one Basic Pokemon to be drawn in your starting hand at the beginning of each match.
  • By building a deck that only has two copies of a single Basic Pokemon , you are pretty much always guaranteed a starter of your choice.
  • As ex cards are considered Basic Pokemon for many legendaries and powerful non-evolving or first form specimens, this enables players to create some very powerful strictures with this mechanic.
  • By running Misty , there is a chance that you can get an attack out in your first turn, even if you started first —which is absolutely huge. This allows you to get the upper-hand on your opponent before they even have a chance to react, if all works well.

This format works really well with the Articuno ex card, as with a perfect coin flip run on Misty, players will be able to attack with the Blizzard move , which can not only 1-hit KO most Basic Pokemon, but also inflicts pressure on the opponent by hitting their benched Pokemon for extra damage.

Articuno Ex 18 Trainers Deck Build

Card Name

Quantity

Set & Number

Articuno ex

  • x2

  • Genetic Apex
  • A1 084

Hand Scope

  • x2

  • Shop Promo #3

Poke Ball

  • x2

  • Shop Promo #5

Potion

  • x2

  • Shop Promo #1

Red Card

  • x2

  • Shop Promo #6

X Speed

  • x2

  • Shop Promo #2

Giovanni

  • x2

  • Genetic Apex
  • A1 223

Misty

  • x2

  • Genetic Apex
  • A1 220

Professor's Research

  • x2

  • Shop Promo #7

Sabrina

  • x2

  • Genetic Apex
  • A1 225

item.title: Honkai: Star Rail - Graduation Contact List Achievement Guide
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Get The Graduation Contact List Achievement Guide In Honkai: Star Rail
  • Graduation Contact List Student Locations In Honkai: Star Rail

Unlocking the Paperfold University in Honkai: Star Rail will lead Trailblazers into new hidden secrets to discover. The unlocked area is divided into four sections; Cultural Corridor, Glaux Sculpture, Creator’s Market, and Chromasweven Avenue. Each section has its Treasure chests to unseal, puzzles to solve, and Achievements to acquire.

Among the Hidden Achievements players can stumble upon while exploring The Penacony Paperfold University College is the Graduation Contact List Achievement in Honkai: Star Rail . The challenge demands players to locate seven college students in exchange for five Stellar Jades.

How To Get The Graduation Contact List Achievement Guide In Honkai: Star Rail

To get the Graduation Contact List Achievement Guide in Honkai: Star Rail , players need to sign the Paperfold University Yearbook of seven students , which are:

  • Richie
  • Chaletka
  • Gabbana
  • Arfey
  • Dafanchy
  • Montana
  • Czipo

Trailblazers must complete Banana Outrage: Battles Without Ninja and Humanity Trailblaze Continuance Mission in Honkai: Star Rail to locate the first three students. Meanwhile, locating Czipo, Dafanchy, Arfey, and Montana requires completing the Sound Hunt Ninjutsu Inscription Event .

Graduation Contact List Student Locations In Honkai: Star Rail

Richie Location

To locate Richie and sign his Yearbook:

  • Teleport to Cultural Corridor Space Anchor.
  • Head east toward the shop icon.
  • Talk to Richie.
  • Ask, “ What can I do for you? ”
  • Sign his Paperfold University Yearbook.

Chaletka Location

Chaletka is running a sweet shop at Penacony Paperfold University College. To find her stall and sign her Yearbook, players need to:

  • Fast Travel to Creator’s Market Space Anchor.
  • Walk toward the Paperfold University Dessert Club shop.
  • Choose the “ What can I do for you? ” Dialogue option.
  • Sign her Yearbook.

Gabbana Location

From the previous location in Honkai: Star Rail , move west and converse with the Performing Art Club President, Gabbana. Next, choose the dialogue option with the “ ? ” icon to sign her Paperfold University Yearbook.

Arfey Location

Go back to the Creator’s Market Space Anchor, but this time head northeast to the end of the corridor. Arfey will be standing beside the Dreampeek Call booth at the end of the hall. Strike up a conversation with her to sign her Yearbook.

Dafanchy Location

From the previous location, enter the western room to locate Dafanchy in front of the chalkboard. Talking to her and choosing the dialogue option with the “ ? ” icon will allow Trailblazers to sign her Yearbook.

Montana Location

Head to the Central Stage at the center of Paperfold University by walking from Dafanchy or teleport to Glaux Sculpture Space Anchor to find Montana. Speak with her to then ask, “ Do you need me for something? ” To complete the sixth signed College Yearbook in Honkai: Star Rail .

Czipo Location

Czipo is standing south of the Central Stage at Paperfold University. Walk up to him and talk to sign the final Paperfold University Yearbook and acquire the Graduation Contact List Achievement in Honkai: Star Rail .

item.title: The Forever Winter: How to get a Tactical Camera
item.description:
The Forever Winter has players scavenging battlefields, fighting or evading squads of soldiers and war machines, and generally trying to survive in a horrible situation. Information is king when it comes to stealth, so gadgets like the Tactical Camera can be tremendously helpful as you explore.

The Tactical Camera is a gadget in The Forever Winter that takes up a large item slot, allowing you to scan the area ahead to locate enemies and lootable containers. Good use of this gadget can help you avoid large patrols and navigate the environment with greater safety. Unfortunately, like most items in the game, the Tactical Camera can be lost if you die and fail to recover it on your next run, so knowing where to get a replacement is essential if you want reliable access to this tool.

Option 1: Buying a Tactical Camera from the Rig Trader in The Forever Winter

Once you've deposited enough water into the Water Storage, you'll gain access to the Rig Trader. The Rig Trader sells Tactical Cameras, finally allowing you to replenish your supply without relying on random chance. Of course, if you don't mind rolling the dice, you can always try option 2.

Option 2: Finding a Gacha Box in The Forever Winter

One option for tracking down a Tactical Camera is a simple as getting lucky. Gacha Boxes can spawn throughout the game as large items that, when extracted, can be opened for a bounty of randomized loot. The Tactical Camera Gadget is among the possible results for opening a Gacha Box, so if you need another reason to always grab these crates when you see them, this is it.

Finding these requires a bit of luck, but they seem to spawn in the same places that Large Lockboxes commonly spawn, so make a note of any such spots as you find them and then make a habit of checking those locations whenever you're in the area.

item.title: Pokemon Fan Creates Adorable Halloween Eeveelutions
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Pokemon fan creates unique Halloween Eeveelutions, drawing inspiration from classic seasonal themes.
  • Eevee designs include Impeon, Frankeon, Swampeon, and more, each with individual traits linking them to Halloween icons.
  • In-ProgressPokemon plans to create a Trick-type Eeveelution inspired by jesters, adding to the collection next year.

A Pokemon fan has shared their collection of Halloween-themed Eeveelutions that they've created over the last few years. The adorable Pokemon creations draw inspiration from everything from Halloween candy to classic seasonal spooks like witches and vampires, putting an adorable holiday twist on the classic Pocket Monster.

Pokemon fans often combine their favorite Pokemon with themes from outside the games. Some have been reflected within the titles as well, with Halloween costumes in Pokemon GO and Pokemon floats even showing up during the annual Macy's Thanksgiving Parade. This fan's imagination has combined Eevee with a number of classic Halloween icons, and they're delighting those who enjoy the spooky holiday.

Pokemon fan and artist In-ProgressPokemon has shared a myriad of Eevee designs they've come up with since 2020, all themed around Halloween. The incredible list of creations includes Impeon, Frankeon, Strawmeon, Goopeon, Reapeon, Voodeon, Mummeon, Swampeon, Cerbeon, Pumpkeon, Vampeon, Howleon, Spookeon, Candeon, and Witcheon. The names and designs of the Pokemon draw from obvious inspirations surrounding Halloween, like mummies, the underworld-dwelling dog Cerberus, pumpkins, candy corn, and more. Each Eeveelution is individualistic, with neat features like Goopeon being semi-transparent with visible bones, and Cerbeon sprouting three heads.

Pokemon Fan Shares Inspiration and Future of Eevee Designs

In-ProgressPokemon has received plenty of praise for their unique Eevee creations, and they don't plan on stopping here. One fan lamented that while there while Candeon was a Treat-type, the collection of Eevees lacked a Trick-type to go with it. In-ProgressPokemon revealed that they have an idea for a Trick-type, which will likely join the group next year, and that it will have a design inspired by jesters. Some fans thought that these Eeveelutions would be great to see in an actual game with altered typing, like turning Reapeon into a Ghost-type.

Eevee's evolutionary tree has become stagnant over the last many iterations of the games, with no new forms being added to the line since Sylveon was added in Gen 6 with Pokemon X and Y . It's surprising to long-time fans of the series, as for a while, at least one new Eeveelution was practically guaranteed per generation of games. Fans are clearly eager for more Eevee in the games, but it remains to be seen if any new ideas make it to a future title. Sadly, a flying-type Eeveelution was seemingly created but scrapped according to a recent Pokemon leak, putting the future of the Pokemon's evolutionary line in question.

item.title: Pokemon Trading Card Game Pocket Has God Packs
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Pokemon TCG Pocket players find "god packs" with rare cards like Pikachu EX and Zapdos EX.
  • These god packs mimic physical cards with elaborate and immersive digital illustrations.
  • With extremely low odds of obtaining them, god packs are an exciting surprise for players to collect.

Several Pokemon Trading Card Game Pocket players have discovered that the game has “god packs.” The Pokemon franchise has been adapted into many media, such as manga, anime, and mainline games. This year, the franchise reached a new milestone with the release of Pokemon Trading Card Game Pocket , bringing a new, yet familiar adventure for all fans.

Announced in February this year during the Pokemon Day 2024 celebrations, the new game created by DeNA offers players the experience of the iconic trading cards for Android and iOS devices. Pokemon TCG Pocket players can battle against each other using a simpler version of the rule system available for physical cards. It's also possible to collect cards with nostalgic artwork, exclusive to the mobile game, and immersive cards. As the community began its race to collect them all, players made an important discovery.

With the release of Pokemon TCG Pocket , players are finding popular god packs. This is the case of content creator SauceMcGavin, who shared a video on Twitter showing the pulls of one of these packs. The first card is a Pikachu EX, followed by an Electrode, a Zapdos EX, a Wigglytuff EX, and a Nidoqueen. Like the real-life Pokemon EX cards, the digital version also has elaborate illustrations and effects that recreate the holographic details, with the Zapdos one having 3D effects.

Players Surprised to Discover God Packs in Pokemon Trading Card Game Pocket

While SauceMcGavin drew attention to the existence of god packs in Pokemon TCG Pocket , this is not an isolated case. There are several reports on social media from other players who were surprised to find these packs. In the replies, one player shared a screenshot of their pulls of a God Pack, which resulted in two Dragonite cards, a Giovani trainer card, and two EX cards, one from Marowak and one from Mewtwo, showing the Legendary Pokemon in a different illustration to the one shared by the OP. A second trainer showed their pulls, these being three EX cards (Articuno, Mewtwo, and Gengar) and regular versions of Weezing and Pidgeot.

For collectors of physical Pokemon cards, the term “God Pack” is not unfamiliar, as it refers to high-rarity cards obtained from certain expansions. With Pokemon TCG Pocket , it's no different, and players have extremely low odds of getting these coveted packs containing cards of one-star rarity or higher. For trainers planning to put together impressive Pokemon card decks, whether for battling or simply for showing off to friends, knowing that there are god packs in Pokemon TCG Pocket will be an extra reason to play the game.
